prompt.system_instruction: You are an AI Assistant, tasked with providing responses that are well-grounded in the provided documents. Given one or more documents and a user query, generate a response to the query. If no answer can be found in the documents, say, "I do not have specific information".

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: How can I get a restraining order without notifying the other person of my address?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: Unfortunately, I do not have information on how to keep your address confidential from the person you are seeking the restraining order against.

contexts.text:
Civil Harassment | Superior Court of California | County of Tuolumne
The court can order a person not to: threaten or harass you, contact or go near you, your home, your work, or have a gun. You can also ask for protection for your family members or other household members. You can get a civil harassment restraining order against people who are not close to you, such as roommates, neighbors, co-workers, or non-immediate family members.
The protective order can be enforced by law enforcement agencies after the defendant has been served.
In some instances, a civil harassment restraining order is not appropriate. You can ask for a domestic violence restraining order if:

A person has abused you, and you have a close relationship with that person (married or registered domestic partners, divorced, separated, dating or used to date, live together, or used to live together*); or

You are related (parent, child, brother, sister, grandmother, grandfather, mother-in-law, son-in-law); or

You have a child with the person.

* You have to be more involved than just roommates.

Related Information
Domestic Violence
Elder Abuse

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: How can I get a restraining order without notifying the other person of my address?

contexts.text:
Civil Harassment Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

Request to Modify / Terminate Civil Harassment Restraining Order: Instructions on Service (Step 2) Packet (CV\E-CH-06)

Filing Fee

 	You will be required to pay a 
	filing fee when you file your forms with the court. Acceptable payment types: Check,
 	Cash, Cashier's Check, Money Order, and 
	Credit Card (Visa and MasterCard). If you are unable to pay the filing fee, you may request
 	a 
	fee waiver.

 	If the Request for a Civil Harassment Restraining Order is based on a credible threat of violence or
 	stalking, the filing fee may be waived by the Judge.

Where do I file my forms?

 	Present completed forms to the Civil Front Counter - Window 14 in Room 102 of the 
	Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse, 720 9th Street, Sacramento, CA
 	95814. The hours of operation are 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

 	One (1) original and one (1) copy of all documents are required at the time of filing.

 	For more information and the necessary forms, see the 
 	Request for Civil Harassment Restraining Order (Step 1) Packet (CV\E-CH-01).

When will I get my order?

 	If your forms are completed and filed by 11:30 a.m. you will receive your Order at 4:00 
 p.m. the same day. If the forms are filed after 11:30 a.m., then the Order will be
 ready for pick up after 4:00 p.m. the next court business day. The forms will be
 returned to you in the 1st Floor Lobby outside of Room 102 at the 
	Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse. In most cases, a hearing will be set
	within 21 days for you and the other party.

	It is the responsibility of the petitioner to have the respondent personally served
	no later than five (5) days prior to the scheduled hearing date. Proof of service
	for the respondent must be filed with the court prior to or at the time of the
	Civil Harassment Restraining Order hearing.
contexts.title: Civil Harassment Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: How can I get a restraining order without notifying the other person of my address?

contexts.text:
Civil Harassment Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse. In most cases, a hearing will be set
	within 21 days for you and the other party.

	It is the responsibility of the petitioner to have the respondent personally served
	no later than five (5) days prior to the scheduled hearing date. Proof of service
	for the respondent must be filed with the court prior to or at the time of the
	Civil Harassment Restraining Order hearing.

NOTE: The Restraining Order is not activated until
 	the respondent is properly served.

How to get the other party served?

 If the party you are serving lives or works in Sacramento County, the Sheriff's Civil Bureau - external link 
 can serve the documents to the other party. They are located at 2969 Prospect Park Drive, Suite 200, Rancho Cordova, CA 95670. 
 If the person to be served lives and works outside of Sacramento County, contact the Sheriff's Office of that county for help. 
 Be sure to contact them promptly so they will have enough time to serve the respondent before the scheduled hearing date.
 

 If you prefer, someone you know can serve the restraining order documents to the respondent. The server must be over 18 and not be one 
 of the parties protected by the restraining order. Once service is complete, the person who served the papers must complete a Proof of Personal Service (CH-200).
 

 For more information and the necessary forms, see the 
 	Civil Harassment Restraining Order: Instructions on Service (Step 2) Packet (CV\E-CH-02).
 

What if I can't get the restraining order served in time for the hearing or I need
 	a continuance?

 	You can ask the court to "continue" the hearing on your Civil Harassment Restraining Order
 	to another date. To request a new hearing date, you will need to file a 
	Request to Continue Court Hearing and to Reissue Temporary Restraining Order (CH-115) - external link
 and a 
 Notice of Hearing Date and Order on Reissuance - external link (CH-116).
 The forms must be completed and filed along with a copy of your Temporary Restraining Order
contexts.title: Civil Harassment Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: How can I get a restraining order without notifying the other person of my address?

messages.original_text: According to the document, when filing for a Civil Harassment Restraining Order, you are required to provide your address to the court. However, the document does not provide information on how to keep your address confidential from the person you are seeking the restraining order against. It is recommended to contact the court directly or consult with a legal professional to discuss your options in maintaining the confidentiality of your address.

Workplace Violence Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

from any individual that can be construed to be, or to have been, carried out at 
 the workplace, may seek a restraining order through the court. An employee may not
 seek a Workplace Violence Restraining Order on his or her own behalf.

 	The Judicial Council provides an informational sheet 
 How Do I Get an Order to Prohibit Workplace Violence?(WV-100-INFO). This informational sheet
 describes court orders an employer can get and how to obtain them. The instructions do not cover all
 of the problems and questions that may arise in a particular case. If you are not clear
 on how to protect your rights, you should consult an attorney.

 	Additional information about Workplace Restraining Orders can be found on the
	California Courts' Website.

Workplace Violence Form Packets


 	Petition for a Workplace Violence Restraining Order (Step 1) Packet (CV\E-WV-01)

 	Workplace Violence Restraining Order: Instructions on Service (Step 2) Packet (CV\E-WV-02)

 	Request to Continue Court Hearing (Workplace Violence) Packet (CV\E-WV-03)

 	Request to Renew Restraining Order Packet (Workplace Violence) (CV\E-WV-04)

 	Request to Renew Restraining Order (Step 2) Packet (Workplace Violence) (CV\E-WV-07)

 	Request to Modify / Terminate Workplace Violence Restraining Order Packet (Step 1) (CV\E-WV-05)

 	Request to Modify /Terminate Workplace Violence Restraining Order: Instructions on Service Packet (Step 2) (CV\E-WV-06)

Filing Fee

 	You will be required to pay a 
 	filing fee when you file your forms with the court. Acceptable payment types:
 	Check, Cash, Cashier's Check, Money Order, and 
 	Credit Card (Visa or MasterCard). If you are unable to pay the filing fee, you may request a
 	
 	fee waiver.

 	 If the Petition for a Workplace Violence Restraining Order is based on a credible threat of violence
 	 or stalking, the filing fee may be waived by the Judge.

Where do I file the forms?

contexts.text:
The Superior Court of California - County of Ventura - Family Law
Note: For assistance in preparing your restraining order documents for filing with the court, please contact the District Attorney Victim Services Unit in Room 311 of the Hall of Justice Building at the Ventura Government Center or at the Ventura County Family Justice Center located at 3170 Loma Vista Rd., Ventura, CA., 93003.
When filing your documents with the clerk of the court, you will need to present an original and two copies of each form. The original will remain with the court and the copies will be made to look like the originals and returned to you. One copy is for your file and the other is to be served on the other party.

Family Law forms are available on the court website under Court Resources The Superior Court of California - County of Ventura - Form Packets.

 
 Forms may be handwritten in a legible form. The Court reserves the right to reject documents determined to be illegible.
Ex-parte applications must be filed before the hearing.


 Filings can be submitted to the court via US Mail at:
 Ventura Superior Court
 Attn: Family Law Clerkâs Office
 PO Box 6489
 Ventura, CA 93006

 A drop box is available outside of the courthouse for those who wish to drop filings without making an appointment to file in person with the Clerk's Office. Filings that are deposited in the drop box Monday through Friday, before 4:00 p.m., excluding holidays will be filed the date they are received. Filings that are deposited in the drop box after 4:00 p.m. will be filed the next business day.

 E-Delivery is also available Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., excluding holidays for delivery of filings electronically. The link to eDelivery is available on the Court Website http://www.ventura.courts.ca.gov/eDelivery.html.

Request for continuances may require a Declaration and Order or Stipulation and Order. The clerk cannot grant a continuance.

Please read our Limitation on Counter Filings.

Options for Filing Court Papers

In person, by appointment. Appointments can be scheduled by clicking the following link:

ml.tokens.model_text: ventura restraining order how to file

contexts.text:
Family Law | Superior Court of California | County of Tulare
You can also obtain information about electronic filing from your Electronic Filing Service Provider, or by calling the clerk’s office at (559) 730-5000, option 4.
Can I appear remotely at the hearing on my petition for a domestic violence restraining order?
Yes.  You can find instructions for remote appearances here.   You can call (559) 738-2330 to obtain assistance regarding your remote appearance.  This telephone number is staffed before and during court sessions.  You should call this number if you are having difficulty with a scheduled remote appearance.
How to Request Copies
The cost for copies is $.50 per page. If certification is requested, an additional $25.00 per document will be assessed.
Please provide the following information:
Petitioner's and Respondent's name
Case Number
Specific documents requested
To request copies by mail, submit a check payable to "Clerk of the Court." DO NOT SEND CASH. If the total amount is unknown, indicate under the amount line "not to exceed $35.00." The correct amount will be filled in and a receipt will be forwarded, along with the requested copies. All checks must be preprinted with the maker's name and address. Copy orders are filled within 7-10 working days.
Please include a self-addressed, stamped envelope large enough to accommodate the request.
Requesting Certified Judgments
To request a certified copy of a judgment (divorce decree), please provide us with a case number. If you do not know the case number, you must provide us with the full names of both parties at the time the divorce was filed and the approximate year of the filing.
You may mail your request, along with a self-addressed envelope with sufficient postage and a check or money order for $15.00 plus $.50 per page copy fee. Or you may visit the office Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Requesting Copies of Paternity Cases
To request copies from a paternity case, you must come into the office and show picture identification. Information/copies can only be provided to the actual parties listed on the case.

Restraining Orders

Home > Restraining Orders

Restraining Orders
Where Do Restraining Orders Get Filed?

Restraining Orders

 	There are different types of civil restraining orders, each with their own eligibility requirements
 	and steps that need to be taken to get a restraining order. The types of restraining orders are:

Emergency Protective Order:
Protects victims of abuse, serious harassment, or stalking. An emergency protective order is available 24 hours a day from the police.

Domestic Violence Restraining Order:
Protects individuals from a spouse or former spouse; person you are dating, or person you have dated; lover; mother or father of your child;
	anyone closely related to you by blood, marriage, or adoption (example: mother, father, child, brother, sister,
	grandparent); or person who regularly lives in your home.

Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse Restraining Order:
Protects elders and dependent adults from physical and financial abuse,
	 	neglect, isolation, abduction, harm, or deprivation by a caregiver.

Civil Harassment Restraining Order:
Protects individuals from someone you have not dated and do not have a close relationship with like
contexts.title: Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

messages.original_text:
To file a restraining order, you will need to follow these general steps:
1. Determine the type of restraining order you need based on your relationship with the person you want to restrain (Emergency Protective Order, Domestic Violence Restraining Order, Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse Restraining Order, or Civil Harassment Restraining Order).
2. Obtain the necessary forms for the type of restraining order you need. These forms can usually be found on the court's website or obtained from the court clerk.
3. Fill out the forms completely and accurately. Make sure to include all relevant information about yourself and the person you want to restrain.
4. File the forms with the court clerk. You will typically need to provide the original form and one or two copies. The court clerk will keep the original and return the copies to you, stamped "filed."
5. Serve the other party with a copy of the filed restraining order. This must be done according to specific rules and timeframes, which vary depending on the type of restraining order.
6. Attend the court hearing. At the hearing, you will have the opportunity to explain why you need a restraining order. The person you are seeking to restrain will also have the opportunity to present their side of the story.
Note: The exact process may vary depending on your jurisdiction, so it's important to consult the specific instructions provided by your local court.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: In Sacramento, you would file a restraining order at the Sacramento Superior Court. The specific steps for filing a restraining order can vary depending on the type of order you need.

Domestic Violence Restraining Order:

contexts.title: Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

messages.original_text: In Sacramento, you would file a restraining order at the Sacramento Superior Court. The specific steps for filing a restraining order can vary depending on the type of order you need. For instance, if you're seeking a Domestic Violence Restraining Order, you would fill out the necessary forms, have them reviewed by the court, and then attend a hearing. However, the process for ensuring your address remains confidential during this process is not specified in the document. You may need to contact the court directly or consult with a legal professional for guidance on this matter.

messages.text: There are several types of restraining orders in Sacramento Superior Court, including Emergency Protective Order, Domestic Violence Restraining Order, Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse Restraining Order, Civil Harassment Restraining Order, Firearms Restraining Order, and Workplace Violence Restraining Order. Each has its own eligibility requirements and procedures.

Where do I file the forms?

 Present completed forms to the Civil Front Counter - Window 14 in Room 102 of the

When will I get my order?

contexts.text:
Firearms Restraining Order: Sacramento Superior Court

Request to Terminate Gun Violence Restraining Order Packet (CV\E-GV-05)


 	Request to Terminate Gun Violence Restraining Order (Step 2) Packet (CV\E-GV-05-02)

Where do I file?
File Your Forms at the Courthouse:

 	Completed forms can be filed in person at the Civil Front Counter - Window 10 in Room 102 of the 
 	
 	Gordon D.Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse, 720 9th Street, Sacramento, CA 95814.
 	The hours of operation are 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

 	One (1) original and one (1) copy of all documents are required at the time of filing.
File Your Forms Online:

 	The eDelivery system is used to electronically submit Gun Violence Restraining Order paperwork to the Court and save you a trip to the courthouse.
Completed forms must be filed Monday through Friday, excluding Court holidays, no later than 11:30 a.m. to be considered and receive a response
 	at 4:00 p.m. the same day. Forms submitted after 11:30 a.m. are ready the next business day at 4:00 p.m.
Steps to file your forms through the eDelivery system:

Complete forms (type or hand-written);
Print the forms;
Sign the forms;
Scan the forms;
Create an account on the 
 	public case access system if you do not have one, or 
 	log in with an existing account.
Follow the instructions on the eDelivery page to submit your forms. Once the documents have been successfully uploaded, you will see a page that displays a confirmation number and date from the system.
Once the forms are processed, you will receive endorsed copies by email, in person at the courthouse, or through the US Mail, depending on your selection.

When will I get a response from the Court?

 	If your forms are completed and filed by 11:30 a.m. you will receive your Order at 4:00 p.m.
 	the same day. If the forms are filed after 11:30 a.m., then the Order will be ready for
contexts.title: Firearms Restraining Order: Sacramento Superior Court

messages.original_text:
There are several types of restraining orders in Sacramento Superior Court, including Emergency Protective Order, Domestic Violence Restraining Order, Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse Restraining Order, Civil Harassment Restraining Order, and Firearms Restraining Order. Each has its own eligibility requirements and procedures. For instance, Domestic Violence Restraining Orders protect individuals from a spouse or former spouse, while Civil Harassment Restraining Orders protect individuals from someone you have not dated and do not have a close relationship with.
If you are seeking a Firearms Restraining Order, you can file your forms in person at the Civil Front Counter - Window 10 in Room 102 of the Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse, or online through the eDelivery system. If you choose to file online, you must complete the forms, print, sign, scan, and submit them through the eDelivery page. You will then receive endorsed copies by email, in person at the courthouse, or through the US Mail.
However, the document does not provide specific information on how to file a restraining order without notifying the other person of your address. It is recommended to contact the Sacramento Superior Court or consult a legal professional for further guidance.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: I am interested in the civil harassment order.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: To file a Civil Harassment Restraining Order in Sacramento Superior Court, you need to complete the Request for Civil Harassment Restraining Order (Step 1) Packet (CV\E-CH-01) and present the completed forms to the Civil Front Counter - Window 14 in Room 102 of the Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse. You will need to pay a filing fee, but if you cannot afford it, you can request a fee waiver. After filing, if your forms are completed and filed by 11:30 a.m., you will receive your Order at 4:00 p.m. the same day. If the forms are filed after 11:30 a.m., then the Order will be ready for pick up after 4:00 p.m. the next court business day. It is your responsibility to have the respondent personally served no later than five (5) days prior to the scheduled hearing date. Proof of service for the respondent must be filed with the court prior to or at the time of the Civil Harassment Restraining Order hearing.

contexts.text:
Civil Harassment Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

Request to Modify / Terminate Civil Harassment Restraining Order: Instructions on Service (Step 2) Packet (CV\E-CH-06)

Filing Fee

 	You will be required to pay a 
	filing fee when you file your forms with the court. Acceptable payment types: Check,
 	Cash, Cashier's Check, Money Order, and 
	Credit Card (Visa and MasterCard). If you are unable to pay the filing fee, you may request
 	a 
	fee waiver.

 	If the Request for a Civil Harassment Restraining Order is based on a credible threat of violence or
 	stalking, the filing fee may be waived by the Judge.

Where do I file my forms?

 	Present completed forms to the Civil Front Counter - Window 14 in Room 102 of the 
	Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse, 720 9th Street, Sacramento, CA
 	95814. The hours of operation are 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

 	One (1) original and one (1) copy of all documents are required at the time of filing.

 	For more information and the necessary forms, see the 
 	Request for Civil Harassment Restraining Order (Step 1) Packet (CV\E-CH-01).

When will I get my order?

 	If your forms are completed and filed by 11:30 a.m. you will receive your Order at 4:00 
 p.m. the same day. If the forms are filed after 11:30 a.m., then the Order will be
 ready for pick up after 4:00 p.m. the next court business day. The forms will be
 returned to you in the 1st Floor Lobby outside of Room 102 at the 
	Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse. In most cases, a hearing will be set
	within 21 days for you and the other party.

	It is the responsibility of the petitioner to have the respondent personally served
	no later than five (5) days prior to the scheduled hearing date. Proof of service
	for the respondent must be filed with the court prior to or at the time of the
	Civil Harassment Restraining Order hearing.
contexts.title: Civil Harassment Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

contexts.text:
Workplace Violence Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court

Check, Cash, Cashier's Check, Money Order, and 
 	Credit Card (Visa or MasterCard). If you are unable to pay the filing fee, you may request a
 	
 	fee waiver.

 	 If the Petition for a Workplace Violence Restraining Order is based on a credible threat of violence
 	 or stalking, the filing fee may be waived by the Judge.

Where do I file the forms?

 Present completed forms to the Civil Front Counter - Window 14 in Room 102 of the
 
 Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse, 720 9th Street,
 Sacramento, CA 95814. The hours of operation are 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday
 through Friday. 

 	One (1) original and one (1) copy of all documents are required at the time of filing.

 	For more information and the necessary forms, see the 
 	Petition for a Workplace Violence Restraining Order (Step 1) Packet (CV\E-WV-01).

When will I get my order?

 If the forms are completed and filed by 11:30 a.m. you will receive your Order at 4:00 
 p.m. the same day. If the forms are filed after 11:30 a.m., then the Order will 
 be ready for pick up after 4:00 p.m. the next court business day. The forms will
 be returned to you in the 1st Floor Lobby outside of Room 102 at the
 
	Gordon D. Schaber Sacramento County Courthouse. In most cases, a hearing will be
	set within 21 days for you and the other party.

	It is the responsibility of the petitioner to have the respondent personally served no
	later than five (5) days prior to the scheduled hearing date. Proof of service for the
	respondent must be filed with the court prior to or at the time of the Workplace Violence
	Restraining Order hearing.

NOTE: The Restraining Order is not activated until
 	the respondent is properly served.

How do I get the other party served?

 If the party you are serving lives or works in Sacramento County, the Sheriff's Civil Bureau - external link 
 can serve the documents to the other party.
contexts.title: Workplace Violence Restraining Orders: Sacramento Superior Court
